intro: Spermacoce princeae, commonly known as the purple rattlebox, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant produces distinctive, elongated fruits that resemble tiny rattles, hence its common name. Spermacoce princeae typically grows in woodland and grassland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
